DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Follicle Stimulating Hormone Measurement Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates whether the laboratory results of a patient meet the criteria for enrollment in a clinical trial regarding the level of serum follicle stimulating hormone.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Follicle Stimulating Hormone Measurement Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._The determination of the amount of follicle stimulating hormone present in a sample._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Serum Follicle Stimulating Hormone Measurement Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:The determination of the amount of follicle stimulating hormone present in a sample.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
The determination of the amount of follicle stimulating hormone present in a sample.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is over the age of
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is over the age of 55 is serum follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) level less than 40 mIU/mL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does female under the age of 55 have a documented serum follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) level less than 40 mIU/mL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does female patient who meets the clinical criteria for menopause but is under the age of 55 have a documented serum follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) level less than 40 mIU/mL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If female patient is on hormone replacement therapy, is plasma follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) level documented to be greater than 35 mIU/mL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If female patient is on hormone replacement therapy and menopausal status is in doubt, has patient agreed to use one of the contraception methods outlined for women of child-bearing potential to continue their HRT during the study or is follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) level documented to be greater than 40 mIU/mL and estradiol level documented to be less than 40 pg/mL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is postmenopausal, does patient have age-related amenorrhea greater than or equal to 12 consecutive months or follicle-stimulating hormone greater than 40 mIU/mL for at least 1 year before the screening visit, OR is surgically sterile (i.e., who had undergone hysterectomy or bilateral oophorectomy)?
